member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Local.SpotifyLocalAPI.PlayURL(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Plays a Spotify URI within an optional context.
member.param: The Spotify URI
The context in which to play the specified .
member.remarks: Contexts are basically a queue in spotify. a song can be played within a context, meaning that hitting next / previous would lead to another song. Contexts are leveraged by widgets as described in the "Multiple tracks player" section of the following documentation page: https://developer.spotify.com/technologies/widgets/spotify-play-button/

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Local.SpotifyLocalAPI.AddToQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a Spotify URI to the Queue
member.param: The Spotify URI

member.summary: Skips the current song (Using keypress simulation)

member.summary: Emulates the "Previous" Key (Using keypress simulation)

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.SearchItems(System.String,SpotifyAPI.Web.Enums.SearchType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about artists, albums, tracks or playlists that match a keyword string.
member.param: The search query's keywords (and optional field filters and operators), for example q=roadhouse+blues.
A list of item types to search across.
The maximum number of items to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
The index of the first result to return. Default: 0
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code or the string from_token.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetAlbumTracks(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about an album’s tracks. Optional parameters can be used to limit the number of tracks returned.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the album.
The maximum number of items to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
The index of the first track to return. Default: 0 (the first object).
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetAlbum(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for a single album.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the album.
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetSeveralAlbums(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for multiple albums identified by their Spotify IDs.
member.param: A list of the Spotify IDs for the albums. Maximum: 20 IDs.
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetArtist(System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information for a single artist identified by their unique Spotify ID.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the artist.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetRelatedArtists(System.String)

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetArtistsAlbums(System.String,SpotifyAPI.Web.Enums.AlbumType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Get Spotify catalog information about an artist’s albums. Optional parameters can be specified in the query string to filter and sort the response.
member.param: The Spotify ID for the artist.
A list of keywords that will be used to filter the response. If not supplied, all album types will be returned
The maximum number of items to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
The index of the first album to return. Default: 0
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Supply this parameter to limit the response to one particular geographical market

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetSeveralArtists(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})

member.summary: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists (shown, for example, on a Spotify player’s “Browse” tab).

A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.
A timestamp in ISO 8601 format
The maximum number of items to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
The index of the first item to return. Default: 0

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetCategories(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a list of categories used to tag items in Spotify (on, for example, the Spotify player’s “Browse” tab).

The desired language, consisting of an ISO 639 language code and an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore
The maximum number of categories to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
The index of the first item to return. Default: 0 (the first object).

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetCategory(System.String,System.String,System.String)

A country: an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter to ensure that the category exists for a particular country.
The desired language, consisting of an ISO 639 language code and an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.FollowPlaylist(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add the current user as a follower of a playlist.
member.param: The Spotify user ID of the person who owns the playlist.
The Spotify ID of the playlist. Any playlist can be followed, regardless of its public/private status, as long as you know its playlist ID.
If true the playlist will be included in user's public playlists, if false it will remain private.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.UnfollowPlaylist(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove the current user as a follower of a playlist.

The Spotify ID of the playlist that is to be no longer followed.

Filters for the query: a comma-separated list of the fields to return. If omitted, all fields are returned.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.GetPlaylistTracks(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)

Filters for the query: a comma-separated list of the fields to return. If omitted, all fields are returned.
The maximum number of tracks to return. Default: 100. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 100.
The index of the first object to return. Default: 0 (i.e., the first object)
An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. Provide this parameter if you want to apply Track Relinking.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.CreatePlaylist(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a playlist for a Spotify user. (The playlist will be empty until you add tracks.)
member.param: The user's Spotify user ID.
The name for the new playlist, for example "Your Coolest Playlist". This name does not need to be unique.
default true. If true the playlist will be public, if false it will be private. To be able to create private playlists, the user must have granted the playlist-modify-private scope.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.UpdatePlaylist(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Change a playlist’s name and public/private state. (The user must, of course, own the playlist.)
member.param: The user's Spotify user ID.
The Spotify ID for the playlist.
The new name for the playlist, for example "My New Playlist Title".
If true the playlist will be public, if false it will be private.

member.name: M:SpotifyAPI.Web.SpotifyWebAPI.ReplacePlaylistTracks(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Replace all the tracks in a playlist, overwriting its existing tracks. This powerful request can be useful for replacing tracks, re-ordering existing tracks, or clearing the playlist.
member.param: The user's Spotify user ID.
The Spotify ID for the playlist.
A list of Spotify track URIs to set. A maximum of 100 tracks can be set in one request.

member.summary: Remove one or more tracks from a user’s playlist.
member.param: The user's Spotify user ID.
The Spotify ID for the playlist.
array of objects containing Spotify URI strings (and their position in the playlist). A maximum of 100 objects can be sent at once.
